TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: uzai a tsautsau ka sitsuayan a puanemanema.
ozai a caocao ka sicoayan a poanemanema.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there was a rich person.

S.FORM: manu kamayan a mangtjez a tsaḍ; ini papaulingavi timadju.
mano kamayan a mangtjez a cadr; ini papaolingavi timadjo.
S.TRANSL: Thieves kept coming and (s)he didn’t feel secure.

S.FORM: qau kinemnem timadju tu "kudain tsu a tsaḍ sa karekutj?" aya timadju a kinemnem.
qao kinemnem timadjo to "kodain co a cadr sa karekotj?" aya timadjo a kinemnem.
S.TRANSL: So he thought: “What can be done to these thieves to frighten them?” he thought.

S.FORM: łakua ini kełang timadju tu kudain.
ljakoa ini keljang timadjo to kodain.
S.TRANSL: But he didn’t know what to do.

S.FORM: manu mangtjez a vuluvulung a tsautsau.
mano mangtjez a volovolong a caocao.
S.TRANSL: Now an old person came,

S.FORM: kivadaqan timadju: "anema su kinemnemnemen?" ayain a kivadaq timadju.
kivadaqan timadjo: "anema so kinemnemnemen?" ayain a kivadaq timadjo.
S.TRANSL: and asked him: “What are you thinking about?” he was asked.

S.FORM: qau tjemumał tua varung nimadju: "avan tsu a tsaḍ a tjuruvu aravats.
qao tjemomalj toa varong nimadjo: "avan co a cadr a tjorovo aravac.
S.TRANSL: So he told him what was on his mind: “It’s this large number of thieves.

S.FORM: ku kudain sa kasualap?, aya ku varung.
ko kodain sa kasoalap?, aya ko varong.
S.TRANSL: What am I to do to get rid of them is what I am thinking.

S.FORM: łakua ini ku kełang.
ljakoa ini ko keljang.
S.TRANSL: But I don’t know what to do.

S.FORM: nu kemłang sun, tjumałi aken," aya azua puanemanema a tsautsau.
no kemljang son, tjomalji aken," aya azoa poanemanema a caocao.
S.TRANSL: If you know, tell me,” said the rich person.

S.FORM: "manu avan azua su kinemnemnemen.
"mano avan azoa so kinemnemnemen.
S.TRANSL: “So that’s what you are thinking about.

S.FORM: łakua maya mapuvarung.
ljakoa maya mapovarong.
S.TRANSL: But don’t worry.

S.FORM: kemłang aken aravats," ayain.
kemljang aken aravac," ayain.
S.TRANSL: I know very well what to do,” he was told.

S.FORM: qau maleva azua puanemanema a tsautsau.
qao maleva azoa poanemanema a caocao.
S.TRANSL: So the rich person was glad.

S.FORM: "nu maitazua sa kemłang sun, tjumałi aken."
"no maitazoa sa kemljang son, tjomalji aken."
S.TRANSL: “If you really know, tell me.”

S.FORM: "ui, ku tjumałay sun.
"oi, ko tjomaljay son.
S.TRANSL: “Yes, I’ll tell you.

S.FORM: uzai a vatu a ku łinengłengan i Gurułan a liaw aravats, maya kinababulay anga.
ozai a vato a ko ljinengljengan i Goroljan a liaw aravac, maya kinababolay anga.
S.TRANSL: I have seen plenty of dogs on Gurułan mountain, and fine ones too.

S.FORM: łakua nu muri vaik itjen a kivatu a sema zua, katsen itjen nua vatu.
ljakoa no mori vaik itjen a kivato a sema zoa, kacen itjen noa vato.
S.TRANSL: But if we go there to get dogs, we’ll be bitten by the dogs.

S.FORM: łakua nu tja saneqavayi tua vaqu, sa tja pataudi tua quvał a qavay, sa tja pakani a kina nua vatu; qau sedjeketsan a angał nua qavay; qau mapusemualap a kina nua vatu.
ljakoa no tja saneqavayi toa vaqo, sa tja pataodi toa qovalj a qavay, sa tja pakani a kina noa vato; qao sedjekecan a angalj noa qavay; qao maposemoalap a kina noa vato.
S.TRANSL: But if we make dumplings of millet and mix hair in the dumplings, and feed them to the mother dog, then her mouth will get stuck up with the dumpling, and the mother dog will do nothing but try to get rid of it.

S.FORM: qau nuka tja sazuain anga, ini anga kełang a vatu tu tja alalapen a ałak.
qao noka tja sazoain anga, ini anga keljang a vato to tja alalapen a aljak.
S.TRANSL: Then even if we go there, the dog won’t know that we are taking away her puppies.

S.FORM: tja alapen a ałak; qau tja katsuin a tjumaq azua kuku, sa tja pakani.
tja alapen a aljak; qao tja kacoin a tjomaq azoa koko, sa tja pakani.
S.TRANSL: We’ll take the puppies, and bring them home, and feed them.

S.FORM: qau nu meqatsa azua kuku, gemurugur a kemats anga, nu mangtjez a tsaḍ nu qezemezemetj.
qao no meqaca azoa koko, gemorogor a kemac anga, no mangtjez a cadr no qezemezemetj.
S.TRANSL: When the puppies get big, they’ll bark and bite, if a thief comes at night.

S.FORM: qau nu katsen nu guruguren a tsaḍ, ini anga turu a mangtjez a
qao no kacen no gorogoren a cadr, ini anga toro a mangtjez a
S.TRANSL: tsemakaw.”
